Midas Documentation » SECTION 5: Run Control » Run Control Programs » mhttpd: the MIDAS Web-based Run Control utility

ODB page



The ODB page is displayed by clicking on the "ODB" page switch button (if present) on the main status page.




Clicking on the "ODB" button will bring up a page showing the root tree of the ODB





The ODB page initially displays the ODB root tree. Clicking on the hyperlink "/", then one of the other hyperlinks ( e.g. "Equipment") will take you to the requested ODB field. Depending on the security, read/write access to any ODB field can be gained .

The ODB page includes the useful capabilities of editing the ODB values and creating or deleting new keys. But for copying ODB trees, saving and reloading the ODB, re-ordering the keys etc., the much more powerful odbedit utility must be used.

Examples:

  • Changing a variable
  • Creating a subdirectory and an array

Changing a variable

This example shows how to change the variable "PA" under the /Equipment/PA/Settings/Channels ODB directory. If the ODB is Write protected (as in the example below) a popup window will request the web password before you can change a value.




ODB page access






Creating a subdirectory and an array

The following sequence shows how to

  • create the subdirectory "Settings" in the ODB tree /Equipment/Detector,
  • create an array called "Names" in the Settings subdirectory,
  • fill the first element of "Names" with the string "LeftFront"




Creating subdirectory "Settings" and the array "Names"
